questions.question_text:
An organization will be deploying a web application in a public cloud with two web servers, two database servers, and a load balancer that is accessible over a single public IP.
Taking into account the gateway for this subnet and the potential to add two more web servers, which of the following will meet the minimum IP requirement?

choices.B: Configure an ACL between the VLANs
choices.D: Configure on-demand routing between the VLANs
choices.A: Implement an ADC solution to load balance the VLAN traffic

questions.question_text:
An organization requires the following to be achieved between the finance and marketing departments:
✑ Allow HTTPS/HTTP.
✑ Disable FTP and SMB traffic.
Which of the following is the MOST suitable method to meet the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
ADC - Application Delivery Controller: it is a load balancer solution. Could be a good solution, you can say "block FTP and SMB traffic" that's not its primary purpose.

-> ACL - Access Control List: here you can open and close doors like in a firewall. 

802.1X - AAA (Triple-A) protocol: a security protocol based on account, using a radius server, the user(supplicant) access with the application server. Here you need Authorization Authentication Accounting, so you doesn't meet the goal. Don't confuse with 802.11 (basic standard wifi)

Routing is Level-3 ISO/OSI model, so it doesn't meet the goal
